1: The fertilized egg implants in the uterus
2: The embryo is about the size of a poppy seed
The neural tube (which becomes the brain and spinal cord) begins to form
4: The heart is now pumping blood
5: Eyes, ears, and nose start to develop
Fingers and toes begin to form
The brain develops into five distinct areas
6: The heart now has four chambers
7: Eyelids and tongue begin to form
The umbilical cord is clearly visible
8: All essential organs have begun to form
The baby begins to move (though you can't feel it yet)
9: The baby can now make a fist
The baby begins to develop reflexes
10: Vital organs (kidneys, intestines, brain, liver) are in place and starting to function
Fingernails and toenails begin to develop
11: The baby is now officially a fetus
The head makes up about half of the baby's length
The baby can now stretch and yawn
12: The baby's sex organs are developing
The baby can now make sucking movements
The kidneys begin to produce urine
13: The baby is becoming more active
14: The baby can now make facial expressions
The baby begins to develop a sense of touch
15: The baby can now sense light
The baby can now hear sounds
16: The baby's eyes can now make small movements
The baby's skeleton is becoming harder
The baby can now make sucking motions
17: The baby is developing adipose (fat) tissue
The baby's heart is now regulated by the brain
The baby's movements are becoming more coordinated
18: The baby's ears are now in their final position
The baby may begin to hear sounds from outside the womb
19: The baby's brain is designating specialized areas for smell, taste, hearing, vision, and touch
The baby may be able to hear your voice
20: The baby is producing meconium (first bowel movement)
The baby's skin is covered with vernix caseosa (a waxy protective coating)
The baby is developing sleep patterns
21: The baby's taste buds are developing
The baby's eyebrows and eyelids are fully formed
22: The baby's lips are becoming more distinct
The baby's eyes have formed, but the irises still lack pigment
23: The baby's skin is still thin and translucent
24: The baby's face is fully formed
The baby's skin is wrinkled and translucent
The baby's lungs are developing rapidly
25: The baby is growing more hair
The baby's nostrils begin to open
The baby's hands are fully developed
26: The baby's eyes begin to open
The baby's lungs are producing surfactant (helps the air sacs inflate with air)
The baby's brain is very active
27: The baby's brain tissue continues to develop
The baby's lungs, liver, and immune system are maturing
The baby may recognize your voice
28: The baby's brain is developing rapidly
29: The baby's muscles and lungs are continuing to mature
The baby's head is growing bigger to accommodate the developing brain
30: The baby's brain is developing grooves and indentations
The baby's red blood cells are being produced in the bone marrow
The baby's bone marrow is now the main site of blood cell production
31: The baby's lungs are almost fully developed
The baby is gaining weight rapidly
The baby's movements may be more restricted as space gets tighter
32: The baby's toenails are now formed
The baby is practicing breathing movements
The baby's bones are fully developed, but still soft
33: The baby's immune system is developing
The baby may be able to detect light
34: The baby's central nervous system is maturing
The baby's lungs are nearly fully developed
The baby is gaining about half a pound a week
35: The baby's kidneys are fully developed
The baby's liver can process some waste products
The baby's hearing is fully developed
36: The baby's circulatory and immune systems are working
The baby is gaining weight rapidly
The baby's lungs are almost fully mature
37: The baby is considered full term
The baby's digestive system is ready to process breast milk
The baby's grasp is now quite strong
38: The baby's brain is still rapidly developing
The baby is ready for life outside the womb
39: The baby's brain continues to develop rapidly
40: The baby's skull bones are not yet fused, allowing for easier passage through the birth canal
The baby is ready to meet you!
